text.p: Following are the main stories in Croatian newspapers on Monday.
- Parliament to debate a radical proposal limiting abortion rights put forward by the Croatian Party of Rights MP, Anto Djapic.

- In an open letter to president Tudjman, which was also sent to cardinal Kuharic, new mothers express their disbelief at the parliament's decision to slash finances for mothers on prolonged maternity leave.
- Money market: Average weekly lending rate rose to 12.1 percent in the week to January 11. Is interest seriously on the rise?
- A dumping site for old computers is being sought. Croatia has no company registered to deal with such waste.

- Some 40,000 Czech tourists to visit the Dubrovnik area this summer. A total of 1.3-2.0 million overnight stays expected and a foreign currency influx of 100 million German marks, equaling some 40 percent of what used to be raked in during pre-war years.

- Politics and preaching should not be mixed, says in an interview father Hrvoje Lasic, a dominican who said mass recently in remembrance of Ante Pavelic, head of the Ustashe-led Independent State of Croatia (NDH) during WW 2. -- Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
